fields.description:
Template
 - basic ec2: instance/sec-group/keypair
 - basic plus triangle services, so add Autoscaling, ELB, CloudWatch
 - basic plus VPC: demonstrates configuring a VPC and running something in it

comments.body: Chat with Lester about app ideas.

will base vpc template on : https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/cloudformation-templates-us-west-2/VPC_Single_Instance_In_Subnet.template
Sure wish I had done GUI-1637 first :-)
Not sure who should evaluate the templates, but for starters, have a look at the sample menu. Work is on the GUI-1637 branch.

[~dkavanagh], IDK how to review this. The text in the dropdown looks good for the set we have, and IMO we need to make sure the sample templates we provide work, and then get feedback from folks like [~lwade] if there are additional sample templates we should provide. 

Please reassign to [~kgill] for code review once you've verified each of the templates you've provided successfully creates a stack (I assume you've already done this and can just pass the ticket on to Kamal, but wanted to be sure). Thanks!

[~jloza], yes, I probably should have noted, but I've confirmed all 3 work as expected. Note that the VPC template only works on a VPC enabled cloud, which I expect will be more and more common. The VPC stack will start creating and fail on the VPC bit and roll-back.
[~dkavanagh]: Is https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1418 the right PR to review for this ticket?
[~dkavanagh], since we can check for VPC-enabled clouds, can we hide the VPC sample template if the cloud is not VPC-enabled?

I wondered if you'd say that. :-) It would involve more detailed checking unless I wanted to do something quick and dirty. The quick method would be if VPC is in the name, verify it's a VPC enabled cloud. Otherwise, I'd need to load and parse the template to look for VPC resources and *that* would be time consuming and delay rendering the wizard.

you know me so well. ;)

Since these are sample templates maybe we could do it as a background task before we load the wizard? Parse and eliminate at some other point? Just spitballing, feel free to ignore my ideas if they are stupid (they probably are stupid).
There's probably something that can be done to load during startup and cache the VPCness of them.
[~dkavanagh]: I don't see a linked PR to code review.
The comments above say the work is on the GUI-1637 branch

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1418
making this as simple as possible. :-)
[~dkavanagh]: Just a heads up that code review of PR 1418 is blocked by UX review of GUI-1637 (since that PR covers 3 tickets AFAICT)

I am able to select the templates mentioned here.
{code}
[root@g-19-11 ~]# rpm -qi eucaconsole
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.1.1                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.6771.448.20150708gitffab808.el6   Build Date: Wed 08 Jul 2015 01:44:59 PM PDT
Install Date: Wed 08 Jul 2015 03:48:37 PM PDT      Build Host: euca-10-111-54-59
Group       : Unspecified                   Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.1.1-0.0.6771.448.20150708gitffab808.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 14575806                         License: BSD and MIT and OFL
{code}
[~dkavanagh]: Do we need to keep branch GUI-1649 open for this?
